intro: Jacquemontia mexicana, commonly known as Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of vines and climbing plants. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Jacquemontia mexicana is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities.
